lineFollowerSim

Class LineSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • lineFollowerSim.SpotSensor
      • lineFollowerSim.LineSensor

  • public class LineSensor
extends SpotSensor
    Create linear array of spot sensors, no public constructor is defined for this class, LFS method createLineSensor() is used instead.
    Author:
    Ron Grant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float arcRadius
      default is 0 (straight line) non zero values used for 1/2 circle, see setArcRadius method.
      boolean noFeatures
      flag that is currently not used.
      float rotationAngle

    • Field Detail

      • arcRadius

        public float arcRadius
        default is 0 (straight line) non zero values used for 1/2 circle, see setArcRadius method. This value can be dynamically modified at each simulation step.

      • rotationAngle

        public float rotationAngle

      • noFeatures

        public boolean noFeatures
        flag that is currently not used. Might be a hint for a useful feature,

    • Method Detail

      • getSensorCellCount

        public int getSensorCellCount()
        Returns:
        number of sensor spots (cells) in this line sensor.

      • readArray

        public float[] readArray()
        Read sensor data acquired from sampling robot view image.
        Returns:
        float[] sized to number sensor cells (spots).

      • setXoff

        public void setXoff(float xoff)
        Set line sensor center at new xoff position in robot coordinates.
        Overrides:
        setXoff in class SpotSensor
        Parameters:
        xoff - X Distance (inches) from robot center. (Distance forward of center)

      • setYoff

        public void setYoff(float yoff)
        Set line sensor center at new yoff position in robot coordinates.
        Overrides:
        setYoff in class SpotSensor
        Parameters:
        yoff - Y Distance (inches) from robot center. (Distance to right)

      • setArcRadius

        public void setArcRadius(float radiusInches)
        When set to non-zero value, line sensor will become a 1/2 circle sensor with given radius. The circle will be centered at the sensor xoff,yoff location and the sensor will project forward unless a negative radius is specified in which case the arc will project backwards more like a "U" shape.
        Parameters:
        radiusInches - Radius of 1/2 circle sensor arc. If zero, sensor is a straight line.

      • getArcRadius

        public float getArcRadius()
        Get sensor arc radius.
        Returns:
        Arc radius in inches

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float angleDegrees)
        Rotate line (or 1/2 circle) sensor by given angle in degrees, positive angle rotate clockwise, negative angle, counter-clockwise.
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - Rotation angle (degrees)
